The unique ID of the business unit.
The automation name.
The automation description.
The unique ID of the automation.
The automation’s starting source. Possible values are Schedule, File Drop, or Trigger.
The email address where notifications about completed automations are sent.
The email address where notifications about automation errors are sent.
The email address where notifications about skipped automations are sent.
The number of steps in the automation.
The unique ID of the automation run.
Whether the automation was set to run once. 1 = true, 0 = false.
For file drop and trigger automations, the file that started the automation.
For scheduled automations, the time that the run was scheduled to begin.
The time that the automation run started. This value is null if the automation was skipped.
The time that the automation run ended. This value is null if the automation was skipped or is still running.
The status of the automation run when the data view is queried. Possible values are QueuedFile, Initialized, Executing, Stopped, Complete, or Error.

The message from the error log, if applicable. If a system or unclassified error occurs, the value is System Error. If multiple errors occur, only the first message is displayed. To get details on multiple errors, use the _AutomationActivityInstance view.
The unique ID of the business unit.
The automation name.
The unique ID of the automation.
The unique ID of the automation run.
The activity type. Possible values are listed in the Activity Type IDs table.
The activity name.
The activity description.
The unique ID of the activity.
Where the activity occurs in the automation. For example, 3.2 is step 3, activity 2.
The unique ID of the activity run.
The time that the activity run started. This value is null if the automation was skipped.
The time that the activity run ended. This value is null if the automation was skipped, is still running, or wasn’t selected as part of an Advanced Run Once.
The status of the activity run when the data view is queried. Possible values are Initialized, Executing, Complete, Error, or NotSelected.
The message from the error log, if applicable. If a system or unclassified error occurs, the value is System Error.
